title: Your body : digestive system
brief_description: The digestive system is responsible for breaking down food and absorbing it into the body to provide energy to fuel all of the body’s functions and processes. This video provides a clear explanation of the following organs and functions of the digestive system: salivary glands, tongue, oesophagus, stomach, small and large intestine, liver, pancreas and peristalsis, the muscular contractions which move food through the entire digestive tract. Also explained are the stages involved in the body’s breakdown of food - from ingestion to elimination. Suitable for Mid-Upper Primary level students. Teacher’s guide included.
